info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 8:19PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Fergus County through 845 PM MDT... At 818 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles west of Crooked Creek Rec Area, or 27 miles south of Zortman, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Fergus County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall with this storm may lead to minor localized flooding, especially in low lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
